intro: Romulea bulbocodium var. clusiana, commonly known as the Clusian marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces dense clusters of violet or blue-violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or marshy areas. Due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
